carsInfo.title: Mercedes-Benz AMG GT Roadster
carsInfo.overview: The Mercedes-AMG Roadster is the most intense way to drive a sports car. You can feel the fascinating genes from the AMG GT even more palpably. Sport car enthusiasts experience emotions, which are often lost in day-to-day life. The AMG Roadster embodies the perfect symbiosis between the typical AMG Driving Performance, and unlimited top-down driving pleasure.

carsInfo.title: Nissan GT-R Premium
carsInfo.overview: There’s not another car on the planet just like this. Refined or no, raining or not, and on a world-famous racing track or just taking the long way to the office one morning, the 2017 GT-R is just as scary, satisfying, and surreal as it ever was as long as you’re willing to push it there. Just be careful of the biting fish.

carsInfo.title: Maserati GranTurismo MC Coupe
carsInfo.overview: The fastest and most focused production car built by Maserati since the MC12 supercar. The MC Stradale is a GranTurismo S that’s benefited from the attention of the Maserati Corse in-house motorsport department. It’s lighter, more performance-minded and more powerful than the standard car: a GranTurismo ‘GT3’, or the closest thing to it.

carsInfo.title: BMW i8 Roadster
carsInfo.overview: Rolling pieces of design that are a snapshot of a point in time. Very few vehicles do that more right now than the BMW i8 Roadster. A supercar that's got one foot in the future and the other in the now.

carsInfo.title: Porsche 911 Carrera S
carsInfo.overview: The Porsche 911 Carrera S is a superlative sports car that has defied its age. It’s a classic, but performs better than nearly any newcomer to its arena

carsInfo.title: Audi RS7 Performance
carsInfo.overview: Cars like the Audi RS7 Performance makes many sports car feel insufficient. It has a certain kind of rush to it. The exhaust note is music to the ears and all that is possible because now this car has 50 horses more than the regular RS

carsInfo.title: BMW M6 GrandCoupe
carsInfo.overview: It’s subtle, yet aggressive at the same time. It speaks volumes to those that know what it is and yet blends in amongst the folk for which it’s not intended to impress. It’s practical, yet sporty, and it’s usable as a daily, but also fun when things get serious. It’s a near perfect blend of two worlds.

carsInfo.title: Maserati GranTurismo Sport Convertible
carsInfo.overview: The GranTurismo Convertible is at its elegant, expressive best with you and its cockpit fully exposed to the open air—the better to savor the sun in your face, the sensual sheetmetal all around you, and, most of all, the sensational, ever-present scream of its glorious, naturally aspirated V-8.

carsInfo.title: Mercedes-Benz AMG GT Coupe
carsInfo.overview: The GT is luxurious, fast, and very, very agile, and we are of the opinion that it’s one of the best supercars ever created. Large, fast, loud and proud, the Mercedes-AMG GT is an uproarious supercar that never fails to thrill.

carsInfo.title: Tesla Model S P100D
carsInfo.overview: The Tesla Model S is one of the most influential, important vehicles produced this century. Driving a car that’s quicker than a Buggatti, but with no engine noise, is a surreal experience.

carsInfo.title: Lexus LC500 Performance
carsInfo.overview: The Lexus LC 500 is as playful and as sharp as you need it to be. With its flamboyant styling cues and 471-horsepower V8, it bridges the gap somewhere between everyday supercar and capable touring car.

carsInfo.title: BMW X6M Performance
carsInfo.overview: Blending unique coupe-like styling with SUV utility and gobs of performance, the BMW X6 M makes its presence known. And felt. Accurate steering, adaptive suspension, and unbelievably wide tires provide plentiful grip through fast sweeping corners. Big, bold and brutal, the X6 commands attention where ever you go.

carsInfo.title: Chevrolet Corvette Z06 2LT Convertible
carsInfo.overview: The Chevrolet Corvette ranks near the top of luxury sports car class thanks to its excellent combination of sporty performance, interior comfort, and livability. It’s a great car for weekend fun or the daily commute.

carsInfo.title: Mercedes-Benz GLE 43 AMG Coupe
carsInfo.overview: The Mercedes-AMG GLE Coupe is all about speed and style. It’s a high-performance all-wheel-drive SUV with a fastback body and twin-turbocharged engines cranking out as much as 577 horsepower. It’s also a sexier, sportier and more expensive version of the more conventional Mercedes GLE SUV. Think of it as the GLE’s more athletic cousin.

carsInfo.title: Cadillac CTS-V Carbon Edition
carsInfo.overview: Cadillac’s most ferocious performance sedan. With a supercharged 6.2-liter V8 and sharp styling that can be likened to a military stealth jet, the Cadillac CTS-V is still one of the most striking performance sedans. And with 640 horsepower on tap, one of the most powerful, too.

carsInfo.title: Porsche Cayenne GTS Performance
carsInfo.overview: Among luxury crossovers, the Porsche Cayenne is the closest thing to a sports car, which means you’ll have a vehicle that’s fun to drive, is spacious, and family-friendly.

carsInfo.title: Land Rover Range Rover Sport Supercharged
carsInfo.overview: The Land Rover Range Rover Sport is legendary for its luxury and off-road ability. It has a high-end cabin, several energetic powertrains, a decent towing capacity, and lively handling.

carsInfo.title: Maserati Levante Gransport
carsInfo.overview: Maserati has carefully toed the line between sport and luxury with the Levante and created a vehicle that seats five in relative comfort and style that’s also able to react sharply when asked to press on a little quicker.

carsInfo.title: Alfa Romero Guilia Quadrafoglio
carsInfo.overview: It's an Alfa. It's something special that is backed by Giulia Quadrifoglio's gorgeous styling, that raspy twin-turbo V-6, lightning-fast steering, and one of the most balanced chassis of any car—sedan.

carsInfo.title: Jaguar F-Type S
carsInfo.overview: It’s luxurious. It’s powerful. It will provide hours of joy trying to nail the perfect downshift, as it comes with three pedals as God intended sports cars to have. Look at it. If that’s not drop-dead gorgeous to you, you need to get your eyes checked.
